p: In the HF group, the ratio of the expansion of small pulmonary veins was also higher (3/7 vs. 0), and the lung lesions can be significantly improved after effective anti-HF treatment. Additionally, there are more findings with a rounded morphology in COVID-19 (9/12 vs. 2/7). Therefore, enlargement of pulmonary veins, lesion distribution, and morphology are highly important clinical findings to identify the chest CT features between HF and COVID-19.
